text: Hello everyone!!! These days i am facing some issues in my design manager. Loading of file takes a lot of time. If i make any change in my file it gets reflected after a couple of minutes and sometimes changes are also not saved.
Cloudflare was having serious issues today
that might be part of it
Yesterday someone deployed some bullshit via flowspec and killed some bgp traffic, what happened today?

Hello guys! We want to switch the templates of all our landing pages. According to this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-do-i-edit-my-blog-email-page-template|HubSpot blog post>, it looks like we can simply change the template and the content will carry over, save for a few drag-n-drops. The screenshot below also supports this.

However, when actually switching templates, all the content from the page disappears and we have to reenter. This will result in us having to essentially recreate all our landing pages. Is there some kind of requirement for templates to be compatible and have the content carry over? Or is there no other way?

Thank you all!
I always clone the template I start with and make sure to keep all the content inside  those sections…if you move them around you are going to have failures

Thank you <@U25PYL3Q8>, I guess this means i can try cloning the template, and making it look like the new one but with the same structure and go from there? Definitely worth a shot! I know the new template we're working with right now is structurally different than the old one for sure.
Yeah, if you are using one large flex column, this is much easier…
I like to suggest refreshing content and images any time doing a redesign like this when the structure changes that way you need to make the content changes as well
